params.name: include
params.description: Array of extra information types to include

params.name: id
params.validator: Must be an identifier, string from 1 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, dot(.), space, underscore(_), hypen(-) with no leading or trailing space.

params.name: environment_id
params.description: necessario se l’host è gestito ed il valore non è stato ereditato da un gruppo di host

params.name: ip
params.description: non necessario se si utilizza una sottorete con DHCP proxy

params.name: mac
params.description: necessario per gli host gestiti di tipo bare metal, non richiesto se è una macchina virtuale

params.name: architecture_id
params.description: necessario se l’host è gestito ed il valore non è stato ereditato da un gruppo di host

params.name: domain_id
params.description: necessario se l’host è gestito ed il valore non è stato ereditato da un gruppo di host

params.name: puppetclass_ids
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: config_group_ids
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: operatingsystem_id
params.description: necessario se l’host è gestito ed il valore non è stato ereditato da un gruppo di host

params.name: medium_id
params.description: necessario se non è disponibile imaged based provisioning e l’host è gestito ed il valore non è stato ereditato dal gruppo di host

params.name: pxe_loader
params.validator: Must be one of: None, PXELinux BIOS, PXELinux UEFI, Grub UEFI, Grub UEFI SecureBoot, Grub2 UEFI, Grub2 UEFI SecureBoot.

params.name: ptable_id
params.description: necessario se l’host è gestito e la partizione personalizzata non è stata definita

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: necessario se l’host è gestito ed il valore non è stato ereditato da un gruppo di host

params.name: compute_resource_id
params.description: nil indica che l’host è bare metal

params.name: root_pass
params.description: necessario se l’host è gestito ed il valore non è stato ereditato da un gruppo di host oppure se password predefinita nelle impostazioni

params.name: host_parameters_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: provision_method
params.description: The method used to provision the host. Possible provision_methods may be build (Basato sulla rete), image (Immagine basata)

params.name: managed
params.description: Flag True/False se l’host è gestito o non gestito. Nota: questo valore indica anche se è necessario usare alcuni parametri

params.name: progress_report_id
params.description: UUID per controllare gli stati dei compiti d’orchestrazione, GET /api/orchestration/:UUID/tasks

params.name: interfaces_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: identifier
params.description: Identificatore del dispositivo, es. eth0 o eth1.1

params.name: managed
params.description: L’interfaccia deve essere gestita tramite DHCP e DNS smart proxy e può essere configurarta durante il provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: provider
params.description: Provider dell’interfaccia, es IPMI. Solo per le interfacce BMC.

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, questo attributo ha la precedenza rispetto a VLAN ID. Solo per interfacce virtuali.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identificatore dell’interfaccia alla quale appartiene questa interfaccia, es. eth1. Solo per interfacce virtuali.

params.name: mode
params.description: Modalità associazione dell’interfaccia, es balance-rr. Solo per interfacce di aggregazione.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Opzioni separate da spazi, es. miimon=100. Solo per interfacce di aggregazione.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

params.name: kickstart_repository_id
params.description: Repository Id associated with the kickstart repo used for provisioning

params.name: release_version
params.description: Release version for this Host to use (7Server, 7.1, etc)

params.name: autoheal
params.description: Sets whether the Host will autoheal subscriptions upon checkin

params.description: Service level to be used for autoheal.

domains.name: Domains
domains.full_description: Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are of the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

params.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).

for example http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.

methods.name: bulk_search
methods.full_description: For every search it returns the list of tasks that satisfty the condition. The reason for supporting multiple searches is the UI that might be ending needing periodic updates on task status for various searches at the same time. This way, it is possible to get all the task statuses with one request.

params.description: List of uuids to fetch info about

lifecycle_environments.name: Lifecycle environments
lifecycle_environments.full_description:
Description

An environment is a basic organization structure that groups hosts, products, repositories, etc. Every host belongs to one environment and it’s isolated inside so that it can see only content that is in its environment.

Chains

Environments are ordered into chains and their content (propducts, repositories, tempaltes, packages) can be moved to an environment only from its prior environment. You can have for example chain like:

Library -> Development -> Testing -> Production

Each change in an environment is done through a changeset in an action called promotion.

Library

Library is a special environment that has no ascendant: All the content starts in this environment. More chains can start from the library environment but no further branching of a chain is enabled.
